data.title: Solid State Chemistry
data.text:
Many Nobel prizes have been awarded in the fields of solid state chemistry and physics. The list below includes links to the Nobel Prize website where you can read a summary of the research for which the prize was awarded and in most cases biographies of the recipients which we thought might interest you.

Chapter 1

Schechtman quasi crystals 2011

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2011/prize-announcement/

Chapter 2

Dubochet, Frank and Hendersen Cryomicroscopy 2017 https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2017/summary/

Schull neutron diffraction 1994

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1994/press-release/

Binnig and Ruler STM 1986

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1986/summary/

Ruska electron microscope 1986

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1986/summary/

Hauptman and Karle direct methods in structure determination 1985

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1985/hauptman/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1985/karle/facts/

Klug electron microscopy 1982

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1982/klug/facts/

Bloch and Purcell NMR 1952

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1952/bloch/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1952/purcell/facts/

Lawrence invention of cyclotron 1939

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1939/lawrence/facts/

Davisson and Thomson electron diffraction of crystals 1937

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1937/summary/

Debye dipole moments and on the diffraction of X-rays and electrons in gases 1936

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1936/debye/facts/

Manne Siegbahn X-ray spectroscopy 1924

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1924/siegbahn/facts/

William Henry and William Lawrence Bragg analysis of crystal structure 1915

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1915/summary/

Von Laue diffraction grating 1914

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1914/summary/

Rontgen X-rays 1901

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1901/summary/

Chapter 3

Bridgman high pressure apparatus 1946

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1946/bridgman/facts/

Chapter 4

Kohn DFT 1998

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1998/kohn/facts/

Pople computational methods in quantum chemistry 1998 https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1998/pople/facts/

Mulliken fundamental work concerning chemical bonds and the electronic structure of molecules by the molecular orbital method 1966

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1966/mulliken/facts/

Bardeen, Brattain and Schockley transistors 1956

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1956/shockley/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1956/bardeen/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1956/brattain/facts/

Pauli Pauli exclusion principle 1945

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1945/pauli/facts/

Chapter 6

Whittingham, Goodenough and Yashino lithium ion batteries 2019

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2019/goodenough/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2019/whittingham/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2019/yoshino/facts/

Chapter 8

Akasaki, Amano and Nakamura blue LEDs 2014

https://www.nobelprize.org/uploads/2018/06/popular-physicsprize2014-1.pdf

Kao work on optical fibres 2009

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2009/summary/

Shikawa, McDiarmid and Heeger polyacetylene 2000

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/2000/summary/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2000/alferov/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2000/kroemer/facts/

Townes, Basov and Prokhorov maser-laser 1964

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1964/summary/

Chapter 9

Fert and Grünberg GMR 2007

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2007/fert/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2007/grunberg/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1977/mott/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1977/vleck/facts/

Néel ferro- and antiferomagnetism 1970

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1970/neel/facts/

Chapter 10

Abrikosov, Ginzburg and Leggett theory of superconductors 2003https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2003/abrikosov/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2003/ginzburg/facts/ https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/2003/leggett/facts/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1987/summary/

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1973/summary/

Bardeen, Cooper and Schrieffer BCS theory 1972

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1972/summary/

Heike Kamerlingh Onnes low temperature physics 1913

https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/physics/1913/summary/

Chapter 11

Geim and Novoselov graphene 2010

https://www.nobelprize.org/uploads/2018/06/advanced-physicsprize2010.pdf

Kroto, Curl and Smiley Buckminster fullerene 1996 https://www.nobelprize.org/prizes/chemistry/1996/summary/

Chapter 12
